explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously (ignition temperature 377degC (Yaws,1997)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Although it is an organic compound including oxygen, not fluorine and chlorine, this oxygen has not chemically bound to any elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: LD50 value 3,301 mg/kg of the oral administration test employing rat (JECFA (1998)), which corresponded to the U.N. GHS acute toxicity Category 5, fell under unadopted category in Japan and were classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From a description of LD50 value of >5,000 mg/kg (Patty (5th, 2001)) in the dermal administration test employing rabbits, it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It is written that there is no mortality in 8-hour saturated steam exposure of rats (Patty (5th, 2001)). Since saturated vapor pressure level (25degC) is 0.0003 mg/L, LC50 value is presumed to be >0.0003 mg/L.. This value is in the range of the Category 1 of the vapor standard, and since classification cannot be specified, classification is not possible.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there is a description, "moderately to severely irritating" (IUCLID (2000)) in the 24-hour administration study with rabbits, it was classified in Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since it has been described that the severe damages to corneal opacity, a conjunctiva, or the iris were seen in rabbits (IUCLID (2000)), and the damage fell level 9 (the highest level is 10.) for rabbits and the corneal injury after 72-hour would be level 10 (HSDB (2002)), it was classified into Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It was classified into "Not classified" from descriptions that skin sensitization was not observed in the patch test to humans (Patty (5th, 2001), IUCLID (2000)), and that skin sensitization was not indicated in the Buehler test employing 20 guinea pig (IUCLID (2000)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Although it is described as negative (Patty (5th, 2001), NTP DB (Access on September 2008)) in the Ames test employing in vitro bacterial cells, classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since it is described that no evidence of carcinogenicityity is reported in the oral administration test employing rats (Patty (5th, 2001)) and no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies is made, classification is not possible.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although it is described that excessive hypersalivation and diarrhea were seen and at high-dose (10,000 mg/kg), decline of nerve line control, and central nervous system control are seen in the oral administration test employing rats (IUCLID (2000)), it is the condition at the dose exceeding the guidance value of Category 2, and, classification is not possible due to insufficient data.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.rationale: It has been described that the effects on stomach were not seen in 150 days oral administration test employing rats (Patty (5th, 2001)) and the effects on organ weights, liver, kidney were not seen in 102 days oral administration test employing dogs. (IUCLID (2000)). Since effects were not seen at the dose out of the range of the guidance value of Category 2 in both of them, it was classified into "Not classified ".

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 72 hours EC50=12mg/L of the algae (Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata) (Environmental Agency eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (1998)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 3, there were no data about rapid degradability and there were bio-accumulation (LogKow = 4.09 (PHYSPROP Database (2008))), it was classified into Category 3.
